p.strong: Student Learning Packets will be distributed on Tuesday, April 14 due to the Easter holiday weekend. Please remember that packets will be available from 7:30 AM-8:30 AM and from 11:30 PM-12:30 PM on Tuesday, April 14th. Thank you for supporting your child's education and completing the weekly packets. If you have any questions, please contact your child's teacher.

div.p: Los paquetes de aprendizaje para estudiantes se distribuirán el martes 14 de abril debido al fin de semana de vacaciones de Pascua. Recuerde que los paquetes estarán disponibles de 7:30 AM-8:30 AM y de 11:30 PM-12:30 PM el martes 14 de abril. Gracias por apoyar la educación de su hijo y completar los paquetes semanales. Si tiene alguna pregunta, comuníquese con el maestro de su hijo.

div.p: Reminder there will be no meal services this Friday 4/10/2020 and Monday 4/13/2020 due to the holidays.

p.strong: Student learning packets are now available for pick up! You can pick up your child’s packet on Monday every week, during breakfast (7:30-8:30) and lunch (11:30-12:30). If you miss your Monday pick up, you can contact Sofia Ontiveros (Parent Outreach Specialist) at (602)353-5056 or by email at
. You can also find a list of resources under Announcements on the main page of our district website

div.p: ¡Los Paquetes de Trabajo Escolar para los estudiantes ya están disponibles para que puedan recogerlos! Usted puede recoger el paquete de trabajo escolar de su hijo cada semana en los días Lunes, durante la hora del Desayuno (7:30-8:30) y del Almuerzo (11:30-12:30). Si por alguna razón no pudo recoger el paquete de trabajo escolar de su hijo el día Lunes, usted podrá comunicarse con Sofía Ontiveros (Especialista Auxiliar para Padres) al (602)353-5056 o por correo-electrónico sontiveros@msdaz.org. Usted también podrá encontrar una lista de recursos en la página principal del sitio web de nuestro Distrito Escolar www.msdaz.org bajo Announcements-Anuncios

p.strong: Update: 3/24/2020- Governor Doug Ducey and State Superintendent of Public Instruction, Kathy Hoffman, announced that the school closures will be extended statewide through April 10, 2020. At this time, all Murphy Elementary Schools (including Head Start and all before and after school activities) will continue to be CLOSED until further notice to support all efforts to minimize the spread of COVID-19 (Coronavirus).
We will continue to communicate with families via our website (
), social media accounts and through robo calls.

div.p: Actualización 3/24/2020 – El Gobernador Doug Ducey y la Superintendente de Instrucción Pública del Estado, Kathy Hoffman, anunciaron que los cierres escolares se extenderán por todo el estado hasta el 10 de Abril, 2020. En este momento, todas las escuelas del Distrito Escolar Primario Murphy (incluyendo el Programa Head Start y todas la actividades de antes y después de la escuela) continuarán CERRADAS hasta nuevo aviso para apoyar todos los esfuerzos para minimizar la propagación del Virus COVID-19 (Coronavirus).
Continuaremos comunicándonos con las familias a través de nuestro sitio web (www.msdaz.org), cuentas de redes sociales y a través de llamadas-robóticas.

p.strong: Hello families of the Murphy School District. As you know, Governor Ducey and Superintendent Hoffman announced on March 15, the closure of all schools as it relates to the recent outbreak of COVID-19. The safest place for our Students during this time is at home. Murphy Elementary Schools will remain closed until further notice. Students will not return to school on Monday, March 23. We will continue to communicate with our families via our website at
, social media accounts and through robo calls.

div.p: Hola familias del Distrito Escolar Primario Murphy. Como ya saben, El Gobernador Ducey y la Superintendente Hoffman anunciaron el 15 de Marzo, el cierre de todas las escuelas en relación con el reciente brote del virus COVID-19. El lugar más seguro para nuestros estudiantes durante este tiempo es el estar en casa. El Distrito Escolar Primario Murphy seguirá en cierre escolar hasta último aviso. Los estudiantes no regresarán a la escuela como ya se había acordado el día Lunes, 23 de Marzo. Continuaremos comunicando a nuestras familias a través de nuestro sitio web www.msdaz.org, medios de comunicación social y vía robo-llamadas telefónicas.

p.strong: Beginning, Tuesday, March 17 and until further notice, the Murphy Elementary School District will be utilizing a curb side meal service for our students & community. We will be offering breakfast and lunch to all children 18 years old and younger. Families may stop by their local school between 7:30 a.m. to 8:30 a.m. for breakfast and 11:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. for lunch. Adult meals are available at $2.00 each.
We will continue to communicate with families via our website (

div.p: A partir del día Martes, 17 de Marzo y hasta nuevo aviso, el Distrito Escolar Primario Murphy utilizará un servicio de comida para nuestros estudiantes y la comunidad que podrán obtener en la acera. Estaremos ofreciendo desayuno y almuerzo para todos los niños menores de 18 años de edad. Las familias pueden pasar por su escuela local entre 7:30 a 8:30 a.m. para el desayuno y de 11:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m. para el almuerzo. La comida para los adultos está disponible a $2.00 cada una.
Continuaremos comunicandonos con las familias a traves de nuestro sitio web (www.msdaz.org) y cuentas de redes sociales.

h3.strong: Please Check Below for our Menus.

div.p: Murphy Elementary District is a public school district serving southwest Phoenix. We are a small and supportive community where we proudly educate students from preschool to 8th grade. We have four schools- Garcia, Hamilton, Kuban and Sullivan. We focus on the development and academic needs of every student and provide the foundation that is essential for student success for high school and beyond.

The Murphy Elementary School District is looking for a new board member! If you are interested in becoming more involved in your school district please reach out to Board Secretary Michele Lopez at (602) 353-5002 for more information. Thank you!

h3.strong: The following information has been provided by the Auditor General's Office, for the full report

p.strong: Our peer group are districts similar in size and demographics to Murphy.

li.p: In 2017 Murphy School District spent 45.4% of all dollars on Instruction, our peer group average was 51.3%.
In 2018 Murphy School District spent 48.4% of all dollars on Instruction, our peer group average was 51.4%.
In 2019 Murphy School District spent 53.3% of all dollars on Instruction, our peer group average is 52.2%.
In 2018 we spent $5,241 on Instruction per student.
In 2019 we spent $5,443 on Instruction per student...2019 the State average was $4,869 and 2019 our peer group was $4,648

div.p: The 2020 Census is well underway and is ready for America to respond as the first invitations are arriving in the mail at an estimated 140 million households between last Thursday, March 12 and this Friday, March 20. The public is encouraged to respond to the 2020 Census online, over the phone, or through the mail with their paper questionnaire as soon as possible.

The 2020 Census count impacts the federal funds that communities receive each year for programs and services that are critical for schools, students, and younger children, including special education, after-school programs, classroom technology and food assistance.

It is critical that children are counted accurately in the 2020 Census, yet they are considered a hard to count population. If you have young children at home and know others who do, make sure they are counted. Here are some tips for counting every young child in your home.

li.p: Count children in the home where they live and sleep most of the time, even if their parents don’t live there.

If a child’s time is divided between two homes, count them where they stay most often. If they evenly divide their time, or you do not know where they stay most often, count them where they are staying on April 1, 2020.
If a child moves during March or April 2020, count them at the address where they are living on April 1.
Count children living in your home if they don’t have a permanent place to live and are staying with you on April 1, even if they are only staying temporarily.
Count newborns at the home where they will live and sleep most of the time, even if they are still in the hospital on April 1.
Remind neighbors to count all children living or sleeping in their home most of the time, regardless of who or where their parents are.

div.p: Visit 2020census.gov for more information on the 2020 Census.

a.strong: Census 101: What You Need to Know

div.p: Parents Rights to Know- No Child Left Behind﻿
